channel.title: Make site pop up when button pressed
channel.description:
ok on top of my client i have button such as file, music, account etc... and i have one called sites and when you click sites someone drops down showing my client here is a pic of what i mean [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/snyujt.jpg[/img]
ok and when you click the forum button nothing happens, i just wanted to know how can i make it so when you click the *******.forumotion.com it actually makes that site pop up. here is the code for that section
[code] String[] SitesButtons = new String[] { "*******.forumotion.com" };[/code]
all help is appreciated

item.title: Make site pop up when button pressed
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

You would add it in the button pressed event handler.

Read full topic

item.title: Make site pop up when button pressed
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

Well doesn’t that mean that only I’ll be able to open it? I want it to be so that next time I update client and that feature is added everybody that clicks it is able to open forums by clicking so basically I want everyone to be able to use

Read full topic
item.source: Make site pop up when button pressed

item.title: Make site pop up when button pressed
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

You can use the Desktop api like so.

if (Desktop.isDesktopSupported()) { // Have to make sure it's supported. try { Desktop desktop = Desktop.getDesktop(); URI uri = new URI("http://www.google.com/"); desktop.browse(uri); } catch(IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } catch(URISyntaxException use) { use.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Make site pop up when button pressed
